page.title: 19The Future.
page.content: The immediate {Future} is uncertain. We await with interest the effects of the abolition of {Greater Manchester {Council,}and what this will mean for us, especially in areas like {Local {Transport.}We also will wait to see how this affects {Rochdale} and its relationships with {Heywood and {Middleton,} its partners. In our schools, as numbers change, we face { {Re-organization,} but as yet, the shape of the new scheme is not clear. It is possible that {Heywood} will emerge as a dormitory town, as we suggested (see p.15) and we would hope this will help to solve the unemployment problem and help the town to keep its separate identity. As for us, we plan {an Exhibition} of all this work in November, and we hope that the co-operation we have gained will continue for a very long time.
